extendedInfo.description: This is a required exam for LPIC-1 or LPI certification Level 1. It covers basic skills for the Linux professional that are common to major distributions of Linux. Each objective is assigned a weighting value. The weights range roughly from 1 to 10 and indicate the relative importance of each objective. Objectives with higher weights will be covered in the exam with more questions. 1.	System Architecture2.	Linux Installation and Package Management3.	GNU and Unix Commands4.	Devices, Linux Filesystems, Filesystem Hierarchy StandardTopic 101: System Architecture 101.1 Determine and configure hardware settings â¢	Weight: 2 â¢	Description: Candidates should be able to determine and configure fundamental system hardware. Key Knowledge Areas â¢	Enable and disable integrated peripherals. â¢	Configure systems with or without external peripherals such as keyboards. â¢	Differentiate between the various types of mass storage devices. â¢	Set the correct hardware ID for different devices, especially the boot device. â¢	Know the differences between coldplug and hotplug devices. â¢	Determine hardware resources for devices. â¢	Tools and utilities to list various hardware information (e.g. lsusb, lspci, etc.) â¢	Tools and utilities to manipulate USB devices â¢	Conceptual understanding of sysfs, udev, hald, dbusTerms and Utilities â¢	/sys â¢	/procâ¢	/devâ¢	modprobeâ¢	lsmodâ¢	lspciâ¢	lsusb101.2 Boot the system â¢	Weight: 3 â¢	Description: Candidates should be able to guide the system through the booting process. Key Knowledge Areas â¢	Provide common commands to the boot loader and options to the kernel at boot time. â¢	Demonstrate knowledge of the boot sequence from BIOS to boot completion. â¢	Check boot events in the log files. Terms and Utilities â¢	/var/log/messages â¢	dmesgâ¢	BIOS â¢	bootloaderâ¢	kernelâ¢	init101.3 Change runlevels and shutdown or reboot system â¢	Weight: 3 â¢	Description: Candidates should be able to manage the runlevel of the system. This objective includes changing to single user mode, shutdown or rebooting the system. Candidates should be able to alert users before switching run level and properly terminate processes. This objective also includes setting the default run level. It also includes basic feature knowledge of potential replacements to init.Key Knowledge Areas â¢	Set the default runlevel. â¢	Change between run levels including single user mode. â¢	Shutdown and reboot from the command line. â¢	Alert users before switching runlevels or other major system event. â¢	Properly terminate processes. â¢	Knowledge of basic features of systemd and UpstartTerms and Utilities â¢	/etc/inittabâ¢	shutdownâ¢	initâ¢	/etc/init.dâ¢	telinit

reviews.title: Excelent!
reviews.comment: Great job. Very stable application and have a good test! Thanks
reviews.author: Carlos Eduardo Bortolotto
